@notice Node operators can deploy this contract to fulfill requests sent to them

attributes.text:
@dev Reverts if request ID does not exist
@param _requestId The given request ID to check in stored `commitments`
@dev Reverts if `msg.sender` is not authorized to fulfill requests

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not an authorized node to fulfill requests"

attributes.type: literal_string "Not an authorized node to fulfill requests"
attributes.value: Not an authorized node to fulfill requests

attributes.text:
@dev Reverts if the callback address is the PLI token
@param _to The callback address

cancelOracleRequest(bytes32,uint256,byte.details: Given params must hash to a commitment stored on the contract in order for the request to be valid Emits CancelOracleRequest event.

params._expiration: The time of the expiration for the request
params._payment: The amount of payment given (specified in wei)

constructor.details: Sets the PliToken address for the imported PliTokenInterface

params._pli: The address of the PLI token

fulfillOracleRequest(bytes32,uint256,add.details: Given params must hash back to the commitment stored from `oracleRequest`. Will call the callback address' callback function without bubbling up error checking in a `require` so that the node can get paid.

params._callbackAddress: The callback address to call for fulfillment
params._callbackFunctionId: The callback function ID to use for fulfillment
params._data: The data to return to the consuming contract
params._expiration: The expiration that the node should respond by before the requester can cancel
params._payment: The payment amount that will be released for the oracle (specified in wei)
params._requestId: The fulfillment request ID that must match the requester's

returns._0: Status if the external call was successful

params._node: The address of the Plugin node

returns._0: The authorization status of the node

getPluginToken().details: This is the public implementation for pluginTokenAddress, which is an internal method of the PluginClient contract

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

onTokenTransfer(address,uint256,bytes).details: The data payload's first 2 words will be overwritten by the `_sender` and `_amount` values to ensure correctness. Calls oracleRequest.

params._amount: Amount of PLI sent (specified in wei)

oracleRequest(address,uint256,bytes32,ad.details: Stores the hash of the params as the on-chain commitment for the request. Emits OracleRequest event for the Plugin node to detect.

params._callbackAddress: The callback address for the response
params._callbackFunctionId: The callback function ID for the response
params._data: The CBOR payload of the request
params._nonce: The nonce sent by the requester
params._payment: The amount of payment given (specified in wei)

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._allowed: Bool value to determine if the node can fulfill requests
params._node: The address of the Plugin node

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdraw(address,uint256).details: The owner of the contract can be another wallet and does not have to be a Plugin node

params._amount: The amount to send (specified in wei)
params._recipient: The address to send the PLI token to

withdrawable().details: We use `ONE_FOR_CONSISTENT_GAS_COST` in place of 0 in storage

returns._0: The amount of withdrawable PLI on the contract

cancelOracleRequest(bytes32,uint256,byte.notice: Allows requesters to cancel requests sent to this oracle contract. Will transfer the PLI sent for the request back to the requester's address.

methods.constructor: Deploy with the address of the PLI token

fulfillOracleRequest(bytes32,uint256,add.notice: Called by the Plugin node to fulfill requests

getAuthorizationStatus(address).notice: Use this to check if a node is authorized for fulfilling requests

getPluginToken().notice: Returns the address of the PLI token

onTokenTransfer(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Called when PLI is sent to the contract via `transferAndCall`

setFulfillmentPermission(address,bool).notice: Sets the fulfillment permission for a given node. Use `true` to allow, `false` to disallow.

withdraw(address,uint256).notice: Allows the node operator to withdraw earned PLI to a given address

withdrawable().notice: Displays the amount of PLI that is available for the node operator to withdraw

userdoc.notice: Node operators can deploy this contract to fulfill requests sent to them
